thread.title: Air China flying non-stop to Pakistan
thread.title_full: Air China flying non-stop to Pakistan

author: eTN Editor
title: Air China flying non-stop to Pakistan
text:
Click here for information and nomination Air China flying non-stop to Pakistan 
To help build economic and political ties with Pakistan, Air China is establishing a newly schedule routes by their fleet of aircraft. This newly established connection will be flown 3 times a week and is just one of many new routes Air China is establishing to connect China with other nations. 
A new connection will be made starting at the beginning of next week when Air China begins service to both Islamabad and Karachi from Beijing. This is the very first airline to connect China with Pakistan with regularly scheduled flights. 
Political ties between China and Pakistan were first established back in 1951. As time progressed, China has developed many programs to help strengthen their relationships with their neighbors in Asia. The latest program is the One Road One Path program to develop economic ties between neighboring nations with China. Be connecting Beijing with both Islamabad and Karachi, the economic and political centers of this Asian Minor nation will be directly connected by an air route with Beijing. Oct 22, 2015
